Member Enumeration Documentation

enum StartUp::Cause
 

Can also be a combination of causes. The startup causes reflect mainly the startup causes sent from stack, when APOXI is started. ATTENTION: An update when the startup cause changes on the running system is currently not performed.

Enumerator:
NormalOn  Normal Power On (Keypress...).
AlarmOn  Power on caused by an alarm.
ChargerOn  Power on caused by plugging on the Charger.
ProductionTestOn  Power on for production test.
AirplaneOn  Power on in airplane mode (only available together with Silent Reset).

Member Function Documentation

void StartUp::Abort (   )  [static]
 

This method cancels the start-up procedure of APOXI without starting any APOXI thread and shuts down the system. It can be called for instance during the initialization of devices or during OnPowerUp of any subsystem which identifies a needless or erroneous start-up. It only has effect when it will be called before StartUp::Restart.

static const Data& StartUp::GetStartupData (   )  [inline, static]
 

Returns:
The startup data, which has been sent from protocol stack to APOXI, when APOXI was started. ATTENTION: Please use the interfaces for PowerHandler and StartUp::Restart to change the startup data during runtime.
See also:
StartUp::Restart

void StartUp::Restart (  const Data &  startup_data  )  [static]
 

This method can be used to change the set of applications (based on the startup data) during runtime. Ensure to change to the corresponding power mode via PowerHandler interface before calling StartUp::Restart. Example to switch form mode ChargerOn to NormalOn: PowerHander::StartMobileNetwork(); StartUp::Data startup_data; startup_data.SetCause(StartUp::NormalOn); StartUp::Restart(startup_data);

void StartUp::Start (  const Data &  startup_data  )  [static]
 

This method is called from Apoxi_startup to initialize the APOXI system and starts the APOXI threads.
